title: tally configuration
description: Configuration schema for tally Dockerfile linter

include.description: Glob patterns for rules to enable (e.g. "tally/*", "hadolint/DL3026").

exclude.description: Glob patterns for rules to disable (e.g. "buildkit/MaintainerDeprecated").

path.description: Write output to this path instead of stdout.

show-source.description: Include source code snippets in output.

fail-level.description: Minimum severity that causes a non-zero exit code.

enabled.description: Allow inline directives to suppress violations.

warn-unused.description: Warn when an inline directive does not suppress any violation.

validate-rules.description: Warn when an inline directive references a rule that does not exist.

require-reason.description: Require a reason comment on every inline suppression directive.

ai.description: Configure opt-in AI AutoFix features (requires an ACP-capable agent).

enabled.description: Enable AI AutoFix. When false, AI fixes are never resolved.

command.description: Argv to launch the ACP agent process over stdio (e.g. ["my-agent", "--flag"]).

timeout.description: Per-fix execution timeout as a Go duration string (e.g. "90s", "2m").

max-input-bytes.description: Maximum prompt payload size in bytes sent to the agent.

redact-secrets.description: Redact detected secrets in Dockerfile content before sending to the agent.

slow-checks.description: Configure async checks that require network or other slow I/O (e.g. registry lookups).

mode.description: When to run slow checks: "auto" enables them in CI, "on" always, "off" never.

fail-fast.description: Stop slow checks on first failure instead of collecting all results.

timeout.description: Overall timeout for all slow checks as a Go duration string (e.g. "20s").
